channel.title: miljko tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from miljko.

item.description: From David Graeber‚Äôs uneven but in parts excellent book BS Jobs. This was my own conclusion after watching that CGP Gray video on AI taking over all the jobs some years back üìö https://t.co/qNQRjf5dJa

‚ÄúWe live in Applicatia, a world where people must spend their days improving their resumes in the hope of improving their lives‚Ä¶‚Äù This is from Experimental History, my new favorite newsletter. https://t.co/SbFG0Fn3o0
üéô Out of the two podcasts about randomized controlled trials that came out this week, I much preferred this one. Confirmation bias. https://t.co/AEn82oFCJW
Svaki ƒçlanak @trzisnoresenje je sjajan, ali ovaj je ba≈° po mom ukusu. I ne samo zbog spominjanja @prikljucenija1! https://t.co/DG87AsDwdm https://t.co/HC3RKVhJsz

Na ponovno slu≈°anje, zaboravili smo da spomenemo gomilu dobrih izvora: - ƒåasopis i radio Elementi @CPNSrbija - @NASAWebb i sve ostalo vezano za JW teleskop - @NakedScientists i mnogi drugi podkasti - Knjige: Riƒçard Fajnman, Karl Sejgan, stari ameriƒçki i novi kinseki SF‚Ä¶ https://t.co/HVrita4DN1

Frustrating to listen. Yes, well-done RCTs are prohibitively expensive and many good ideas are box-checked to death. The solution isn‚Äôt to ration RCTs, but to make them less costly (and not just in money) üéô https://t.co/gsB28YuMTe

üéô A fantastic episode of EconTalk this week: Richard Gunderman and Russ Roberts discuss ‚ÄúMaster and Man‚Äù, Tolstoy‚Äôs short story about two men in a snowstorm, but also about capitalism, sociopathy, and religion. This one will easily make it into the ... https://t.co/qYNItivGT9
@ditheringfm Great! Now if only you could fix @benthompson and @gruber‚Äôs mangling of Tesla‚Äôs name, which really shouldn‚Äôt have any Zs in it.

üß™ Good morning to everyone except to whomever is in charge of the eRA Commons service desk. You‚Äôd think that a multi-billion dollar operation like NIH would have a decent answering service, with a call-back option, number in line, etc. ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ, won‚Äôt use again (if only)
@daringfireball @EconTalker, if you were looking for Kenny G‚Äôs polar opposite in their approach to music, you‚Äôll find none better than Steve Albini. https://t.co/X7obuNO2ff
@mali_gad Bez brige, svet ƒáe brzo naƒái naƒçin da ga upropasti. U stvari veƒá je poƒçeo, pravljenjem priloga na TV-u.

Agree with all points save this one. Fiercely regulated by whom? Impartial regulators impervious to political and social pressures? Might as well throw in a pony. https://t.co/EDuavSmqvS https://t.co/evlmTC89DE

@HomegrownJoan2 @thackerpd I have a sinking feeling that regulators did a California roll through most of those policies and are now dismissing signs of anything wrong happening because hey, they had all those policies in place. Hope I‚Äôm wrong.
‚ÄúThis is the question that haunts me: How much genius are we losing to the compulsive need to scroll just a little bit more?‚Äù Cal Newport has a point https://t.co/0J4862FGKc
